thread.title: Moana’s Auli’i Cravalho Powers Through Getting Hit With a Wave During Oscars Performance
thread.title_full: Moana’s Auli’i Cravalho Powers Through Getting Hit With a Wave During Oscars Performance

author: Eliana Dockterman
title: Moana’s Auli’i Cravalho Powers Through Getting Hit With a Wave During Oscars Performance
text:
Moana star Auli’i Cravalho wasn’t phased by big crowds or big waves during her Oscars performance on Sunday night. A dancer carrying a fake wave accidentally hit the actor in the face while she was singing “How Far I’ll Go” from the movie. Cravalho barely flinched and continued to serenade the star-studded audience despite the snafu.
At just 16 years old Cravalho already seems to be a pro. She voiced the hero Moana in an animated Disney film.
She performed the Oscar-nominated song with one of the film’s music writers Hamilton creator Lin-Manuel Miranda. Miranda will earn the elusive EGOT title if “How Far I’ll Go” wins at the Oscars, winning an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony Award.
